definition:
**Cyclic quadrilateral.**\
A quadrilateral is cyclic when its four vertices lie on a circle.

![image](quadcyclic)

A necessary and sufficient condition for a quadrilateral to be cyclic,
is that the sum of a pair of opposite angles be equal to $180^\circ$.

One of the main results about these quadrilaterals is Ptolemy’s theorem.

Also, from all the quadrilaterals with given sides $p,q,r,s$, the one
that is cyclic has the greatest area. If the four sides of a cyclic
quadrilateral are known, the area can be found using Brahmagupta’s
formula
